title: Ian Holloway takes phone call from Chairman Tony Fernandes mid-interview after QPR victory - receives fine
text:

This is the hilarious moment Ian Holloway took a phone call from his boss Tony Fernandes during an interview with QPR Player HD. 
The QPR boss was speaking after his side's emphatic 5-1 home victory over Rotherham. The west London side have enjoyed a recent good spell of form winning five from their last seven Championship games. 
And clearly happy with his side's win, Fernandes wanted to phone up Holloway and congratulate the 54-year-old. 
But it just so happens The Hoops gaffer was midway through an interview when his phone buzzed. Holloway answers the call (Photo: @QPRFC/Twitter) 
"Tony, can I ring you back," said Holloway. "I'm just doing an interview, mate - you've ruined it. I'm fined now. 
"I'm fined. I'm fined. Alright mate, I'll ring you back. Thanks." 
It appears that the club rule for phones going off during interviews has been triggered by Holloway's very own boss. (Photo: @QPRFC/Twitter) 
But thankfully for Holloway, Fernandes took to Instagram saying he would happily pay the fine: "Classic. So happy after our win 5 1. Called Ian. He was in an interview . Got fined hahahahhahaha. 
"Looks like I have to pay the fine. It's moments like this I love being Co Chairman of QPR. Ian passion is why I got involved in football in the first place." Like us on Facebook
